title: fontlab grid HELP!
content:
I have never worked in fontlab. I have only designed fonts for logo use etc in illustrater. however now I have created a complete font in illustrater in a grid with gridlines every 8 mm and 16 subdivisions. the font is only designed/to be used in kapitals.

My question is: is it possible to paste this font into fontlab with the grid i have used or has the grid got to be dividable with 10? -which would mean that i would have to make the whole font over again..

And how long time would it take if i found someone who could do it??

(i hope i am making sense ´qause i dont really know what I am talking about with Fontlab)

comments.content: Fontlab will let you import Illustrator files. There are very specific steps to take. You might do a search on google to find them. Alternatively, yes, you could get somebody to convert your font for you. Also, Fontlab will support multiple kinds of grids - but is it a bitmap font you want to make? Maybe you should post some images of what you have so you can get better advice.

Mads,

when working in Illustrator and FontLab, it’s better work in points rather than mm because 1 pt in Illustrator = 1 font unit in FontLab. Please read [http://groups.msn.com/fontlab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get\_message&mvie...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105816/http:/groups.msn.com/fontlab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get_message&mview=0&ID_Message=2675 "http://groups.msn.com/fontlab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get\_message&mview=0&ID\_Message=2675")

You can set up any grid subdivisions in FontLab you want.
